newsitem.title: BRAZIL: Brazil Bamerindus deal may get more in PROER funds.
newsitem.headline: Brazil Bamerindus deal may get more in PROER funds.

text.p: A report by Brazil's Central Bank revealed that the HSBC Holdings Plc takeover deal for Banco Bamerindus may involve more than the 5.868 billion reais scheduled in PROER funds, Folha de Sao Paulo daily said.

The government's PROER program includes credit lines to finance mergers and acquisitions in the private banking sector. According to the report sent to the Senate, more financing may be necessary, the newspaper said.
Last month HSBC took over selected assets and obligations of troubled Bamerindus, Brazil's fourth largest private bank, and turned into a new bank called Banco HSBC Bamerindus.
The HSBC takeover deal has raised the amount of funds already granted by the PROER program to 20.745 billion reais, Folha said.
